summary: This document is a Condominium Rider that outlines the obligations of the Borrower in relation to a mortgage secured by a condominium unit. It details the responsibilities regarding property insurance, public liability insurance, and the handling of proceeds from insurance claims or condemnation. The document is significant as it establishes the legal framework for the Borrower's obligations to the Lender concerning the condominium property.

persons.name: Borrower
persons.context: The Borrower is the individual or entity securing a mortgage for the condominium unit and is responsible for adhering to the terms outlined in the Condominium Rider.

persons.name: Fifth Third Mortgage Company
persons.context: The Lender is the financial institution providing the mortgage to the Borrower and has specific rights and requirements outlined in the document.

connections.description: The Borrower is securing a mortgage from the Lender, Fifth Third Mortgage Company, for the condominium unit.

keyFacts: The document is a Condominium Rider dated December 10, 2014.
It outlines the Borrower's obligations regarding property insurance and other responsibilities related to the condominium.
The Borrower must pay all dues and assessments imposed by the Owners Association.
The Lender has the right to receive proceeds from insurance claims or condemnation related to the property.
The document includes provisions for the Borrower to notify the Lender of any lapse in required property insurance coverage.
